result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John E Clay

Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim M.C and L.O(person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

8:42 AM Defendant John E Clay in court, in custody.  Attorney Claude-Allan Milhomme in court for John E Clay.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reporter Taryn Strickland. 

Defense motions to modify bond to sig bond; and indicates that defendant has moved. 
State would like to know where the defendant is living currently; and does not obj to high sig bond. 
BTC: Motion for bond modification granted $1,000.00 sig bond same conditions.
Bail/bond hearing on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
